reviews:
Imperial red ale de 11 % abv, dont on voudrait connaître le niveau ebu, 
plutôt que l'immense blabla ou baratin sur…

650ml bottle split. Pours light murky orange brown with a beige top. Aroma: sweet malts, caramel, orange peel & pith, dried fruits, bourbon barrel, boozy. Taste: moderate sweet & bitter, dry, caramel, toffee, orange citrus, prunes, dates, dried fruits. Boozy bourbon barrel oaky finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Definitely a sipper

A one finger pour from an end-of-the-keg offering at Aces & Ales on Tenaya in LV. 2009 vintage we were told, oh my. Thanks, we will be back. A clear amber in color,  much the appearance of whiskey as a beer. Boozy smell. A cocktail taste, grain, light syrup, boozy taste too. Swell.

2016
Pours slightly hazy copper, cream head, firm and creamy, excellent lacing. Aroma of caramel, dried fruits, marmalade, pine. Tastes bitter and sweet, well balances. The malty side is thick, caramel, nutty, creamy, hops add citrus, bitterness, licorice. Lovely dried fruity notes to linger for a long and dry finish. Full bodied, very smooth, evilish hidden booze. A great classic ale!
Really the embodiment of the style. Strong and boozy, hoppy and bitter, yet remains balanced unlike 99% of these kinds of beers. Stone Berlin

65 cl. bottle, bought at The Situation some years ago. Served at home in a snifter glass. Pours a hazy brown colour, small head with short retention. No lacing.
 Boozy aroma, caramel, dried fruits,licorice, molasses, hops, pine, some citrus.
Medium to full body, creamy texture, no carbonation. Dry sweet and hoppy finish,
Taste of caramel, licorice, molasses, chocolate, hops, citrus.
A beast of a beer.

A 22 fl. oz. bomber, bottled on 15th October 2015. Poured into a snifter glass. It was a cloudy murky rusty orange brown colour with a thin orangey beige head that disappeared quickly while leaving some nice spotty lacing. Aromas of sweet malt, citrusy orange peel, citrus pith, caramel, orange hard candy, bourbon and dark dried fruit like raisins. Tastes of sweet malt, caramel, toffee, light bitterness, grapefruit peel, citrus pith, dried dark fruit, bourbon, piney hops and some light spice. Full bodied with soft carbonation and a touch boozy. Overall a good balance between sweet, bitter and spice. While not overly boozy, it is a sipper, and a nice one at that.

Cloudy ruddy brown with tiny white head. Black treacle aroma. Full body, sticky, gentle fine carbonation. Taste starts with black treacle, dark toffee, raisins, port the some bitter notes develop, in part hops and in part burnt sugar. Good

2015 vintage. 10.5% ABV. On tap at the Stone Brewing Taproom, Berlin on 25-May-2019.  Clear amber in colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of dark fruit, citrus and pine. Full body and soft carbonation. Taste of sweet malt, caramel, dark fruit and floral hops. A healthy hop addition masks the sweetness well. Medium bitterness. Excellent.

On tap at Stone Brewing Tap Room - Prenzlauer Berg, 27.3.19. 10.5%abv., 2015. Dark brown with a white head. Nutty aroma with some alcohol and caramel, sweet, deep caramel, nutty and alcoholic taste. Full body, nutty and bitter finish.

Did drink this beer in 2015 from the local supermarket. It is a good beerbut unlike the normal bastard, it is not a special beer (at least for me) If the bottles were not so expensive, I would probably retry but there are so many beers I want to try or retry

Tasted this at Six Degrees North, Glasgow on the 1st February 2019. Keg dispense, 1/3 pint sampled. Clear garnet in colour with a thin pale buff head. Strong malty aroma with raw Bourbon alcohol burning on the nose. Thin oily mouthfeel and poor lacing. Mixed malt provides Christmas pudding base with sweet caramel, syrupy stewed prunes and dates with notes of blood orange. Difficult to detect powerful hop resins but light orange citrus flavour imparts short bitter intensity. Finish is malty with dry Bourbon burn from the lengthy booze notes, hints of vanilla oak cask and massive prune fruit still driving through. Lethal and proud of it.
contra pressuss heinar pols erlös polaris andar wiking polster westus klarissis

02-01-19 // 2015 version on tap at Stone Brewing Tap Room

Glowing dark amber. Heavy bitter. Strong malty body. Different. Real bastard. Like it.

Color granate oscuro, casi marrón, translúcida. Espuma beige oscuro, amarillenta, de buena retención. Aroma a cereales tostados, madera, licor, caramelo, resina. Complejísima. Sabor igual, más cereales tostados, caramelo y resina que en aroma. Espectacular. Textura casi oleosa. Carbonatación media.

Flaska 650 ml (buteljerad 15 okt 2016). Klar kopparfärgad med ett smutsvitt skum. Dofter av torkad frukt, läder, karamell och malt. Smakinslag av torkad frukt, karamell, spritinlagda fikon, läder och trä. I smaken döljs alkoholen otroligt väl. Fyllig kropp.

Color marrón rojizo. Dos dedos de espuma amarillenta con excelente retención. Aroma a pino, malta y resina. Gusto muy potente en tosodos los aspectos, a malta tostada, malta caramelo, pino, abeto, resina y madera, alcohólica en boca. Cuerpo medio. Un trallazo de cerveza, arisca, peligrosa y compleja desde el primer trago, fuera de serie.

Color marrón rojizo oscuro con espuma baja beige de buena retención y abundante residuo. Aroma a caramelo, frutos secos y malta de todo tipo. Sabor muy intenso a malta quemada, malta caramelizada, madera, bourbon y fuerte amargor terroso con notas resinosas. Regusto largo amargo terroso y a caramelo. Textura cremosa, cuerpo denso y carbonatación muy baja. Si la Arrogant Bastard ya era bruta, esta se lleva la palma, una brutalidad de sabor maltoso con toques de licor, madera y bourbon completamente espectacular.

Big bottle shared with my brother. Pours dark brown with a fine head. Aroma is very malty with loads of bourbon. Underlying complexity with prunes, dark berries and licorice. Huge body, thick mouthfeel. Flavour profile is complex, boozy and malty. Very rich, intense malt, lot of Bourbon. Heavy but lovely.
(robe superbe, nez > malt-alcool-hop-bois-miel-épice puissant, charnue, glissante-amère, last végéto-florale)

Gezapft im Stone in Berlin-Mariendorf. 2013 Version. Dunkles Orange, etwas Schaum. Aroma: Malzig, Rosinen, Leder, Karamell. Geschmack: Schwere Süße, Vanille, Rosinen, dunkle Beeren (leicht), Honig. Volles Mundgefühl. Lange Bitterkeit.
Draft at beertemple. Aroma of malt, resinous hop, caramel and raisin. Taste has dry raisin, resinous hop, bitter caramelised malt, pine and caramel. Good.
Brun- mot bärnstensfärgad öl med ett mörkbeige skum. Doft av malt, bitter citrus marmelad och kåda. I smaken tillkommer fattoner. Något obalanserad för högre betyg.

2 finger beige head.
Clear, deep ruby to light mahogany coloured beer.


Aroma is butterscotch, figs, dried dates, leather, slightly metallic, blackcurrant and slight dark chocolate.


Taste is burnt liquorice, figs, leather, slight red berries, slight butterscotch and charred wood.


Mouthfeel is smooth & soothing. Medium body. Medium bitterness. Medium-low, soft carbonation. Sticky and semi-oily body.


Overall: Really good Strong Ale. Has a very "red" ale feeling about it, with the metallic & caramel notes but I like a lot in this. Delicious and pretty drinkable despite the ABV.
Flaska Systembolaget. Bärnstensfärgad.  Doft av tall, citrus och marmelad. Tjock humlig smak med tyngd i malten. Citruszest, tall, kåda och spannmål
Flaska beställd från SB mörkt brunröd med ljusbrunt skum. Tung,söt doft med aprikos och karamell. Samma smaker med värmande alkohol.
11/20 much to admire, but not that enjoyable. Ultra bitter, very caramel and boozy. It's a beast - a bit too hardcore for me
Husté, velmi dobré, plné, řízné, hořké, alkoholové. Tomu se říká skvěle udělané pivo od Stone.. :)

65cl bottle from 2016. dark amber colour. small white head.
Sweet malts, caramel, honey, a hint of alcohol, floral notes.
Medium bitteness, low/medium carbonation.

Aroma is quite sweet, honey, candy, peppermint candycane, and grandma's assortment. Feels good on the palate; good mix of sweetness, spicyness, and bitterness. Taste is spicy, dark bread, and black pepper.

On tap at Fakin Zagreb. Dark golden/amber coloured, small to medium sized off-white head, dried fruits and caramel in the nose. Heavy sweet malty, caramel, notes of marzipan and quite noticable alcohol with light herbal bitter finish with again notes of alcohol.
0.3l draught. Cloudy amber red color with white head. Aroma of cough syrup, caramel, malt, honey and floral aroma. Taste is sweet and bitter with alcohol present in taste, but not overwhelming.
On tap at Fakin bar, Zagreb. Amber color with medium brownish head. Fruity and malt aroma with floral notes. Light bitter floral taste.

Tap at Fakin, Zagreb. Misty red-amber body, tan head if I remember correctly. Boozy barleywineish malty aroma, choco-caramel, light marzipan, alcohol. Malt-driven dry candish malty taste - quite lovely - edged by some alcohol but also by a nicely distinct hoppy bitterness, very well integrated and a perfect counterpoint to the malt assault. I was never impressed by the regular Arrogant Bastard (there, I said it), somewhat wimpy for all its bluster when I've had it, but its big brother is definitely an excellent beer.

On tap at Fakin Craft Bar, Zagreb. Shared with Peh. Deep amber, medium off-white head. Malty, biscuit, fruit jam, berries. Thick, sticky. Strong. Alcohol hidden. Sweet. Medium to full body. Low hops but present in the finish.

Cloudy amber. Full body, smooth texture, very flavorful, hot mouthfeel, lingering aftertaste, flavorful , bitter finish. Bitter, moderately sweet, crisp, good balance. Coffee, caramel, maple, hoppy, blackberries, herbal, milk. Delicious. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Opaque amber in color with minimal head from the tap. Smell is molasses. Taste has some good caramel flavors. Slightly syrupy in taste, but not feel. Astringent alcohol all the way through. The bitterness from the healthy dosing of hops is welcome, but gets a little comingled with the alcoholic bite that didn't feel well-covered.

(tap 0,3l @ OP (Brno))

Aroma: Sweet, malty, melanoiden.

Appearance: Dark amber-red. Medium, beige head.

Taste: Medium sweet, malty, fruity, light spicy, light alcohol.

Palate: Medium-full body. Warm, light bitter finish.

Overall: Good warmer.

no nie jestem masochistą, będę się wedle zaleceń trzymał z daleka od tego piwa. słodowy potwór, ani do jedzenia, ani do picia, w rzeczy samej gorszy brat pojedynczego aroganta, trochę parodia mocnego piwa kraftowego, wierzę że zamierzona.

2015er version, many thanks to Werckmeister for organising this bottle! Smooth mild floral intense beginning. Fruity, warming and malty grainy. Pine, malt, warming floral. Round and fresh, smooth, sticky but still sessionable! Great stuff!

2015 Bottle at home, shared with the Beast, 13th January 18. Pours dark mahogany brown, not much head. Aroma is cararmel, dark fruit and malt. Taste is complex, bitter and sweet, loads of malt, caramel and older hops, giving some great bitterness still. Reminded us both of Brewdog Hardcore a little, with more malt. Not overly sweet and a great beer, that drank below the 11.0 ABV.

Dress garnet speckled by yeast, clear tobacco of East foam. Aromas of roasted malt, caramel and the litany of US hops in all their magnificence. Powerful taste, doesn't exactly have a gentle touch, bitter size above XXL. There is burnt, astringency, cough syrup, candied fruits, overdosed alcohol, pharmaceutical fluid. A little too much, you sait arrogant ..

Pours a deep, dark amber coloration with a large, creamy head. Smells of caramel malt, toffee, red berries citrus and pine. Taste follows the nose, with a caramel, biscuity malt backbone and some toffee, chocolate and red berries, complemented by hoppy notes of citrus and pine. This really is an Imperial Arrogant Bastard, which really piles on the malt, without losing much of the hops. Depth of flavor seems more intense compared to normal AB, especially when it comes to the malt presence and fruitiness. Hop profile seems a little more mellow, although there still is considerate piney bitterness (this may be due to the 26 months old bottle). The higher ABV is noticeable as a slight, warming presence, but there really is no unpleasant boozyness to this at all. What really needs to be highlighted compared to normal AB is the thick, smooth mouthfeel, which is absolutely sublime.
2009 vintage, tap at Stone Berlin. Pours clear, deep amber with a small, beige head. A little bit of cardboard, loads of caramel. Still sticky and resinous. Well aged and well hidden ABV.

AROMA - burnt caramel and malt
APPEARANCE - solid mahogany with lacing. 
TASTE - burnt caramel, toffee, marshmallow, nut, plum, roasted malt, hops, spice, oats. 
PALATE - big and bold, boozy in back. 
OVERALL - I would buy again

Amerykańska butelka 650 ml (11% ABV). Srogi bastard! Doskonały wygląd zewnętrzny butelki (cytat z biblii!), ale i znakomity wygląd piwa - biała piana, ciemnomiedziana barwa piwa, bardzo mętne. Wysycenie średnie. Bardzo pełne i treściwe piwo. Goryczka umiarkowanie wysoka, hardkorowo mocny woltaż.

Tap at Stone Berlin - as 2009 Double Bastard - clear brown color, small white head. taste is caramell, cognac, full malt bomb, sweetish, bitter finish. a very nice sipper. well aged. like a fine spirit. beautiful. alcohol well hidden.

From Mar 2008

his one pours a clear red with a 1 finger head of foam which shrinks during the session to a fine layer with lots of lacing.

The smell is very malty with lots of caramel. Nice. There's also a fairly faint, compared to the malt, nose of hops.

The taste has notes of caramel malt up front followed by some fruit(black cherry), and citrus and piney hops and a pretty big dose of alcohol.
Lots of warming during and after the swallow.

The more sips I take, the less I notice the alcohol and now I'm able to really start focusing on the flavours and man, it's so tasty and so well balanced that I don't want the bottle's contents to leave. *Very* nice sipping Strong Ale and with its creamy smooth mouthfeel and nicely done light carbonation, this is certainly a great brew worthy of its reputation. Highly recommended.

3 liter Bottle at the Aaahhh...øl!!! Julebord 2016. Dark orange body with a small head. Aroma of raisin, ashes, orange. Taste is bitter, grassy, with tangerine, pulp, hay. Very on the grassy side, though an enjoyable beer.

65 cl bottle, served in a snifter. Poured hazy amber with a light tan three finger head. Aroma: candy, overripe banana, pineapple, caramel. Taste: toffee, butterscotch, cotton candy, overripe banana, pineapple, raisins, ginger, vanilla, spices, christmas cake, raisin bread, roasted nuts, cloves. Thick and quite spicy mouthfeel. Medium to full body with a very nice more bitter than sweet finish. Also a lingering gingery spiciness in the long finish. Alcohol nicely hidden. Tastes like a barley wine, especially 'Bommen en Granaten' by 'De Molen' is almost identical to this. But a really fantastic brew on its own! Really enjoying this...

Bottle, 650 ml, courtesy of Max. shared with him, Simon and JFK10000. Pours amber with medium off-white head. Fruity, hops, pine, citrus, caramel, bit nutty, bit warming, sweet, bitterness in finish. Medium to full bodied. Very nice, didin't expect it to be this good.
On tap at Galbraith's. Pours red brown. Caramel, strawberry, brandy cherry, toffee, pepper, apple. Big body. Delicious.
Soy un amante de la arrogant bastard,pero esta la encuentro algo dulce por el exceso de malta,lo que contradice un poco con el fuerte amargor de su hermana.

Kolor ciemnobrunatny, opalizujący. W aromacie dużo karmelu, ciastek, toffi, suszonych śliwek. Piwo bardzo pełne. Słodkie, oblepiające, karmelowe. Goryczka wyraźna i nieco przeszkadzająca. Wyczuwalny alkohol

650ml bottle. Pours a clear copper hue with a one finger with a beige head. On the nose, lots of barley wine like notes, resinous hops up front, heavy caramel malts, tropical fruit underneath, and a note that is almost like vanilla cake. Lighter bodied than expected, but sweet with some alcohol burn, resinous notes, sweet caramel malt, with mineral hopping that heads into bitterness over burnt sugar, a faint floral note, lots of eucalyptus, and the faintest hit of coffee. It definitely seems more barley wine than anything, but I have few complaints. BOOM to the taste buds!

Un biere bruneâtre, aux reflets roux, avec peu de carbonatation et peu d’effervescence. Ca sent le sucre d’orge, le caramel, bref, c’est sucré et malté. En bouche, ca ressemble beaucoup à un vin d’orge à l’américaine, avec une certaine amertume poignante, ainsi qu’un goût assez malté, assez alcoolisé. L’alcool enlève peut-être un peu de complexité à la bière. Je l’aime pas autant que l’arrogant standard. Manque de profondeur.

Version 2015 vom Fass im Stone Brewing Berlin 2016-11 getrunken. Ok bei dem schlagen die Bitternoten im Mund nicht gleich die Zähne aus wie ich es von dem einfachen Bastard kenne. Gut gemacht, aber mehr als paar kleine Schlückchen werden es hier lieber nicht.
On tap at St Augustine’s in Vancouver. A medium amber beer with a bit of white head. Not much nose on this paddle sample. A bit of fruit and plenty of grainy malt. 3.4

Bottled on 10/14/15. Served from 22oz bottle into glass at home. Pours deep amber red in color, medium high clarity, with a tan colored head. The head quickly diminishes to a a thin ring of bubbles on the glass. Legs visible when agitated. Assertive aroma, sweet caramel malt and lots of alcohol, resulting in a preserved fruit character. Some fruitiness that may be alcoholic esters or hops. Flavor is more malt with lots of alcohol and high hoppy bitterness. The body is full, almost chewy, medium low carbonation with a decidedly dry finish. Even with all the alcohol aroma and flavor there is little heat detectable at the finish. Overall this beer lacks the hop character expected, but that is most likely due to the age of the bottle. It comes off as an aggressively bitter American barleywine and really is an amped-up version of the original.

Bottle. Pours with perfect head, some sedimentary particles floating in, I forgive. Quintessence of delicate, affordable caramel. Honey, delicate note of baltic porter, vanila, coconut, little alcohol. Mouth and palate: dense, oily, average carbonation, vulgar alcohol. Good, but not worthy these 50-sth zł. in Poland.

W aromacie karmel ale tak jak w zwyklym bastardzie jest on baza calego piwa, jest fajny. Do tego sok z cytryny. Barwa ciemnobursztynowa, plywaja w nim nieapetyczne paprochy. Piana ladna, drobna, utrzymujaca sie. W smaku geste, jest tez karmelowe. Alkohol lekko wyczuwalny, lekko szczypie w przelyk. Goryczka konkretna, fajnie cytrusowa. Wysycenie srednie. Bardzo fajne piwo, nazwa bastard bardzo do niego pasuje.

Draught at Bootleggers Craft Beer Bar. Clear, amber colour with a thin off-white head. Sweet aroma with caramel, fruits, grasses, rich greasy malts, citrus, roasted notes, ripe fruits, faint liquorice. Taste is bitter. Full body with an oily texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes lasting bitter with an aggressive hops bite. Big, fat vulgar - American. Maybe even outdated?

26.05.2017, tap @ Apollon:

Nice light amber slightly fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is sweet concentrated grassy, sugar, sap, minerals, grass, caramel malts, leafs, hops, hay, alcohol, moss, citrus peel. Taste is sweet concentrated grassy, leafs, sap, sugar, wet grass, wet hops, minerals, hay, bark, alcohol, "knekk", citrus peel, moss. Longlasting bitterness, slightly dry and harsh grassy mouthfeel. Nice enough.

Bottle at home in front of The Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt. Pours a very attractive deep Red/Amber with a cream coloured head. Quite intense aroma of toffee with perhaps a little pine on the edges. Flavour is extremely in your face. Caramel and booze. First impression is sweet but thaat quickly subsides to bitter. The booze has an immediate warming effect on your chest. A huge beer with a lot going on. Very enjoyable.
Big toffee blast on the nose. Caramel, dark fruit (plum; maybe a bit of figgy pudding too), and more toffee. Piney hops, roasted malts. Excellent sipper.

600ml bottle served in a snifter glass. 2016 Edition. Enjoyed at "Au Coin Mousse - Geneva". Pours a dark and cloudy amber color forming a medium tan head with medium retention and some molasses lacings formed and left in the glass. Strong notes of caramel and oak in the nose. Dark dry fruits, honey, hazelnut, apricot and roasted malts. Grassy hops. Taste is slightly sweet in upfront, becoming quickly roasted and bitter. Strong notes of caramel, dark dry fruits, honey, nuts, roasted malts. String hops bitterness kick. Great bittersweet balance. Heavy body. Medium carbonation. Caramel and grassy hops in the aftertaste. Great drinkability. American classic.

A nice complex beer, while strong is easily approachable. Notes of molasses, honey, cereal, raisin, fig compote, apricot, chocolate, hazelnut, coffee and baking spice. Nice and creamy on the palate a true example of one of the best craft brews out of the USA.
Tap @ MBCC. The 2006 year. Clear copper. Herbs, caramel, malt body. Herbal with loads of caramel, some nuts. Nice structured body with long herbal finish.

660ml bottle shared at home. Hazy dark orange with a medium white soapy head. Medium to full body with low to moderate carbonation. Quite some bitterness with subtle fruity sweetness. Pine, malts, caramel, citrus and tropical fruits. Very good.

Bardzo, wręcz agresywnie nachmielone , bardzo słodowe, sporo karmelu, biszkoptowe, rodzynkowe, pomarańcze, żywica, kandyzowane owoce, dochodza lekkie nuty herbaciane, może ziołowe. Piwo bezkompromisowe i potężne.

On keg at Hanging Bat (27/04/17). Pours clear deep amber red. Nose of madeira, molasses, toffee cake, raisins, cherries, parmaviolets. Taste is boozy, oak, resin, super hoppy, earthy notes, complex, long finish.
Pours ruby red with medium head. Aroma: caramel aroma nicely counterbalanced with hops. Taste: caramel, dried fruit and lots of hops. Nice.

Bottle (2016) - 22oz. Dark copper body with a thick, off-white frothy head. Robust, well-balanced, complex malty/hoppy aroma with cinnamon, fruity, maple syrup, and spicy hints. Alcool is subtle. Its robust malty/hoppy taste carries woody, barley sugar, and cinnamon notes. Ends with a long, strong, warming bittersweet finish. Fantastic winter warmer.

Bottle. Pours a murky reddish brown with a thin foamy off white head. Aroma is of toffee, treacle, dark fruits, figs, raisins, blackcurrant, plum. Taste is of toffee, plum, currants, raisins, brown sugar, red berries, maple syrup. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

clear in the first glass, opalescent with a lot of sediment in the second one, mahogany colour, one inch dense yellowish head; aroma of intensive pine resin, caramel, biscuit notes, raisins soaked in liqueur and alcohol; bittersweet taste with tons of resiny hops, syrupy-caramel notes, raisins, maybe other dried fruits and slome spicy alcohol; great strong ale

Bottle from LCBO. I remember my first original arrogant bastard. I was drinking with ratebeer scholar Helsdon -- hey man, we should grab a beer! -- at the Indie Ale House in the Junction & he was marvelling at how the beer was swallowing our taste buds, like a greedy black hole. (Every beer we sampled after this was damaged by the liver bile remnants of the bastard). This version adds to that deep, dark taste bud erosion experience. Big suckerpunch of sugared malts to the mouth, with a deep & rich cough syrup hop bitterness beneath the sweetness. The booze is sloppy & heavy & embarrassing, like a drunk step-mother falling down the stairs during a family get together. Hard to love this. Hard to ignore it. Try it once & try not to notice the cough syrup after reading my review.

2014 bottle, 22oz; Dark grainy amber, minimal head; Got carried away with stuff so forgot to write this part; Fantastic brew, full of intrigue and surprise, charisma and character...all with an aged expression.
bomber pours dark amber off white head aroma is booze and citrus taste is the same dry finish with a sweet malt flavor added

Draught @ Fox & Hounds, Sønderborg. Pours slightly hazy ruby with airy but stable off-white head. Clear aroma of malt, fruit, hops and yeast, with booze in the long nose. Bitter flavour of hops and alcohol, with fruity an malty notes and touches of grass. Bitter, boozy and estery aftertaste. Bormally I am not fond of boozy bastards but this one is good :-)

Pours a beautiful amber color with a boozy floral scent. Extremely hoppy and bitter on the palate at first, followed by a sweet malty aftertaste. 
Definitely not for the novice beer drinker.

Közepes, tartós hab, barna szín. Karamelles, gyümölcsös illat, picit fűszeres. Karamell, kandis cukor, aszalt gyümölcsök érezhetőek az ízében, némi fűszeres felhanggal. Erősen keserű, nagy testtel, közepes szénsavtartalommal. Intenzív ízvilágú sör, egy picit sok a karamell.

As I’ve said before, one Bastard’s plenty enough for me. And while I do appreciate a few of the Double Bastard variations I’ve come across, I don’t have much love for the original DB. Just such a wildly aggressive beer, super sweet, monstrously bitter, boozy as all hell, an assault on the palate I’m not that happy to undertake again. (In fact, not sure why I’ve ended up with another bottle o’ Double Bastard, having sworn it off at least twice before. Fuck it. I’ll just blame Trump.) Anyway, the pour’s decent, the nose warns you of the massive malt-hop avalanche to come, but nothing really prepares you for that one-two punch of sweet toffee-caramel mixed with pure pinecone resin hops. Deep dark veins of brown sugar, maybe even a hint of white chocolate, followed by a little dried apricot, then on to the sweet, boozy, IBU-packed finish. I get why people dig this beer. I also understand why I don’t. Never trust a Bastard that comes in pairs.

650ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a deep reddish-amber colour with one finger of head. Aromas of caramel and dark cherries. Taste matches the aroma with a IPA style dry and hoppy finish. Medium-bodied with moderate carbonation. High alcohol level is concealed well. Interesting brew. Recommended.

Bottle 650ml @ home

Pours hazy deep amber with a beige head. Aroma has notes malt, caramel, dried fruits, alcohol, citrus, orange and pine. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium to heavy bitter with a long malty, caramel, orange, citrus and piney finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Couleur ambrée foncée; mousse beige; arômes et goût maltés et fruités; alcool bien présent; finale très amère

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It pours murky ruby with crimson tinges; the head is tan and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: grapefruit pith, fresh cut grass, pine resin, celery, toffee, alcohol, pepper, and licorice. The taste is lightly sweet that finishes fucking bitter.The palate is full bodied, and slightly sticky; the carbonation is medium; the finish is long and bitter. Overall, this beer is pretty dang American - insert edgy political humour.

Bottled 10/12/16. Pours hazy, dark brown with a thick, fluffy beige head. Tons of fruits in the aroma (dates, figs, tangerines, & plums); some floral hops in the mix as well. Flavors arrive similarly with dark fruits leading; caramel & hops following behind. Actually finishes with an peppery, chalky bitterness along with booze. And that finish is the part where it falls off. It’s got that medicinal (Theraflu) bitterness. Aftertaste is harsh & uninviting, much like Arrogant Bastard. Warms up with less bitterness but also becomes much more astringent & solvent-like with booze. It ain’t a drain pour but certainly not the best in its price range either.

Bottle from Elysium. Aroma: Nice caramel, dried fruits and American hops, very intensive and rich. Appearance: Brownish body with low head. Taste: Sweet and bitter, lots of caramel, dried fruit, hoppy notes, very high short biterness. Palate: Semi-dry finish, high body, low carbonation.
I thought it will be better.. what I remember the most was the taste of alcohol.. I bought it for bitterness but I was disappointed

650ml bottle from Elizabeth Station at Ilya’s. Bottled on 2016-10-13. Pours an opaque copper with a beige head. Aroma is dark fruits, candied citruses, sweet. Taste is the same. Moderate bitterness, low to moderaye sweetness. Hoppy and boozy bitterness aftertaste. Good stuff.

Bomber. Delicious malty, hoppy aroma. Beautiful copper color, white head that lingers for a while. Little lacing, but understandable given alcohol content. Smooth hop flavor. Bitter aftertaste but pleasant. Full bodied. Overall a delicious beer, but strong.

Hazy, deep amber to red colored, medium- beige creamy head, nice lasting. Aroma is of caramel, malt, dried fruits, some hard candy, orange, floral and citrus hops. Taste is medium+ sweet malt, caramel, orange hard candy, dried fruit, light chocolate, floral, citrus and fruity moderate notes, medium+ bitterness, dry finish. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, oily-sticky. Probably waited too long to get the most out of it but still very nice!
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

Tap at brewery in Escondido. 2004 version.  Murky light mahogany with medium white head. Aroma is raisin, alcohol, and sweet feel. Sharp bite of sugar, alcohol, raisin, some tartness. Powerful beer with good complexity.

Potężne i absorbujące. Nawet nie wiem czy to się przyjemnie pije, ale to piwo robi kolosalne wrażenie. Potęga słodowej bazy, potęga chmielowych aromatów i potęga monstrualnej goryczki. Zupełnie niezbalansowane ale w tym szaleństwie jest metoda - z chęcią skosztowałbym jakiegoś barrel aged’a :)
Huge malty beer with the hops to back it up. Pine and pepper with malt no roast but a tad breads and toast. Great rich mouthfeel and an everlasting malty finish.

Brown colour, off white head. Aroma of malts, caramel, nuts, booze, berries. Taste is medium sweet, light to medium bitter. Medium body, creamy texture, soft to acerage carbonation. A bit boozy. Celebrating quiting my job today.
Botella . @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Frikicata Gijón 24/01/2015. Color

Medium dark amber. Massive caramel, grapefruit, candied apples, cherries, mildly sweet. Big fully body tons of hops and tons of malt with great caramel malt backbone. Smooth. Alcohol well hidden. Perfectly balanced and perfect American strong ale. Good bitter finish.

Bottle @ "Frikicata Cervezorama", Sr. Lúpulo, Gijón. 24-01-2015.

66cl bottle. 2014.

Pours hazy amber with nice off white head. Short head retention, some lacing. Malty, caramel, liquor notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is malty, liquor, caramel, fruity. Alcohol noticed, some sweet notes. Very robust, boozy punch. A bit unbalanced,
Fresh from the tap at Stone Berlin. Dark copper with a imposant white foam head. Great body. Subtile bitterness.

Tap at Pizza Luce. Deep orange with white head. Caramel, alcohol, orange pulp, grapefruit and pine sap. Medium caramel sweetness quickly overcome with a resiny, citrus bitterness. Medium body with a soapy feel.
From a 500 ml caged and corked bottle it is a clear Amber color with a slight head the aroma is bourbon and the taste is sweet bourbon flavor with a strong boozey finish
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Look: clear copper with unstable white head.

Aroma: sweet, malt, light spicy alcohol notes, barberry candies.
Taste: moderate to strong sweetness balanced with strong hoppy bitterness.
Flavour: malt, berries, red currant jam. 
Hop profile: woody, grassy, earthy.

Very good.

The aroma of yeast and raisins. The taste is alcohol, yeast, raisins and honey. Very bitter aftertaste that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. It gets better when it gets warmer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle 
Red brown, off white head 
Aroma of caramel and honey 
Taste sweet, nice round. Alcoholic raisin.
Bottle. Pours red with cream head. Aroma has notes of caramel, alcohol and grains. very dry and sweet.
Fantastic in every way! The color is absolutely brilliant as is aroma and taste. I can’t find anything to not like with this one!

Pours a dark ruby/red color with lots of sediments floating around and medium tan head with long duration. Aroma has caramel, toffee, resin, citrus and pine. Taste follows the aroma, toffee, caramel, citrus, resin, pine drops, bread and spices. Alcohol is really well hidden. Intense bitterness in the aftertaste. Really nice brew!

medium aroma – fermented fruits, rum, flowers, a bit of malt, some cereals, belgian yeasts.
strong taste – spicy, fermented fruits with a lot of alcohol, rum, hop’s bitterness, green herbs, belgian yeasts. good beer!
BOBMER shared. Rich malty caramel and bread, fruity, smooth spicy alcohol. Big malts, lots of spicy hops, as well as spicy booze. Very good.
Dark amber, clear (hop haze on the bottom of the bottle), small head. Sweet candy in the aroma. More candies in the taste along with good long lasting hoppy bitterness.

This beer is one of my friends favorite beers from one of his favorite breweries. I can see why, we are taking a minute to remember his life with a 2007 bottle. Chocolate, toffee, burnt sugars, and fruity alcohols. This is a style that will always remind me of him. Cheers my friend, may you rest in peace.
22oz bottle. Clear copper with a foamy tan head. Flavors are caramel, resinous hops, earth and alcohol with fruity and grassy notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.

Light amber pour with off-white head. Big spruce and citrus aroma as head falls. Hop bitterness is high, but balances well with caramel malt. Impression was almost like bitter lemon curd. Mouthfeel was slick initially, and the medium body lightened by average carbonation. Alcohol taste is not apparent, despite high ABV. Strong bitterness in finish and tongue dries out slowly between sips. Not a hop head myself, but had to try this one out! Recommend sharing this one, unless, of course, you like to burn out on American hops!

Tap@Taphouse, Copenhagen (Stone TTO 27/11/2016) - dark amber brown coloured pour with beige head. Medium sweet malty aroma and taste, toasty, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, dried fruity and nutty, some spices on the palate, medium sweet bitter finish

Sampled from tap at Stone Garden Berlin. Hazy amber color with medium eggshell head. Aroma is toffee, pine, doesn’t smell that old! Taste is toffee, oxidized (but in the nice way), spruce, resinous. Oily mouthfeel, fine-bubbled low carbonation. Held up way better than expected. Nice stuff!

Tap at Taphouse. 63 taps stone tap takeover. Clear brown smooth brown head. Mild malty aroma. Slightly like walnuts. Flavor is strong and very complex with layers of notes like malts nuts fruits and a good bitterness to balance. Lovely flavor.

Exorbitant schwer und wollüstig fassograndig. American Strong Ale der Extraklasse. So sollte DAS Kaminbier munden. 2005er Vintage Tap Edition vom Hahn in der STONE BREWERY BERLIN. 0,15/3,30€.2016er:  9/4/10/5/19 Kratziger KaramelRotfruchtGott mit Alphasäurewiderhaken. Kantig,garstig,Outstanding. Citrusfresh. ??? Vintage 2006er : 8/4/9/5/19 Kellermuffler mit abgeschlagenen Kanten. A Vintage ASE Masterpiece mit Dezentoansatz, wenn man das so sagen darf ??  MCBC 2017...Vintage 2015: Fassware. Stone Berlin.... 8/5/9/5/19 Rot, hoppy, phenolkratzig und immer hart boozey. HardRinder mit IRIPA HEADNUTAPPEAL ??? AGAIN: VINTAGE 2010. Tap Stuff. 8/4/9/5/19 Grey, smokey & freakfunky💥...STONE Berlin.
11 % abv. Bottle. Bronze color, creamy foam. Malty aroma: dried fruit, raisins, figs, caramel and port wine. Taste: malt, candy, fruit, candy, raisins and candied fruit, sweet, good hop bitterness.

BOTTLE. 2015 (BO10/23/15). Clean amber pour with thick creamy head.. Thick sappy musky resiny nose, Anzac biscuit as well??.. Big malt base, biscuit, caramel/treacle, long sappy hop bitter bite that lingers.. ABV is definitely there Sourced Cellarbrations @ Capel

Vintage 2015; Pours Orange like copper, slightly clear, but still muddy with yeasts, and stable, off-white yellowish foamy head wtih spotty lace. Aroma: intense hop and malt aroma, pretty well balanced together: malts takes on white bread, toffee. caramel, some hazelnuts, hop aroma takes on citruses, pine, florals...Flavor: very similar to aroma: very malty flavor, with intense caramel, toffee, bread like note, with hint of hazelnuts, candy sugar, supported with huge hop flavor, which takes on fruits mentioned above. Finish is slighty dry, almost sticky, very bitter, bitterness lingers long in aftertaste. Body is medium to full, texture is super smooth, almost creamy, carbonation is medium. Alcohol warmth is noticeable, oaky boozy. Amphibian betwen Barley wine and imperial ipa.

Bärnstensfärgad åt det röda hållet. Fyllig och tät öl. Sirap och toffee, men spritigheten slår igenom vilket jag inte gillar.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sample from a bottle. Hazy dark amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, alcohol, hops, spice, dried fruit, caramel and oak.

Pours a cloudy reddish Amber with a smooth silky head. Aroma is malty. Very malty. Taste is malty and syrupy to the extreme up front and equally bitter on the back end. Smooth like a milkshake. Refined and raw power at the same time. I can't believe I haven't rated this before. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 650ml (2015). Served at cellar temperature. Pours a hazy copper. Head is beige; average sized and lasts wonderfully in the glass. Aroma is sweet and hoppy with notes of pine needles, hop resins, overripe nectarines, overripe apricots, sultana’s, lightly toasted malts, sticky caramel, hints of vinous alcohol and a touch of chocolate. Flavour is a strong resinous/grassy hop bitterness with lightly toasted malts, cooked toffee, overripe stone fruits (nectarines/apricots), orange rinds, raisins, spruce, bourbon (light) and strong rusty/resinous notes in the finish notes. Full bodied with light carbonation, an oily texture and a good length finish.

0,65 l bottle from Biervana Munich 
Dark Amber, clear, frothy tan-light brown foam head, caramel, bread, cereal, roasty, alcohol, woody, spruce, citrus, heavy cloying sweetness, very bitter, full body, thick feel, sticky, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,
Medium sized tan head. Cloudy reddish amber body. Aroma is surprisingly light considering this is an 11% beer. Fruity on the nose. Very malty flavour, hoppy aftertaste. Quite alcoholic.
Bottle. Pours a reddish brown. Aroma and taste are caramel, toffee, and dark fruits.

Nice aroma with caramel, raisins, wood, pipe tobacco, and a little alcohol. I thought the flavor was surprisingly mild--smooth and malty with caramel and dark fruit flavors. Bittersweet finish with a lot of drying alcohol. Another fine effort from Stone.
Orange color. Heavy sweet aromas, tropical fruits, dried fruits, oranges, caramel. Taste mirrors the aromas with some citrus hops during the finish. Really solid American Strong Ale.

Another great offering from the dark side of Stone. A rich mahogany red body with a thin off-white head. Taste profile blends some fresh and powerful elements - earthy and fruity hops, rich, sweet caramel malt, dark berries, brandy and a hint of nuttiness. Rich and sustained taste.

Very nice bottle - perfect!!!!
A red cloudy beer with a beige nice head, malty, light bitter, oily, full body, good balance, long finish, yeast dominated, compared with a Belgian beer very perfect, 
(I have 0.65l bottle which is bottled on 10/15/15)

2014 bottle. Appearance- ruby red, dark brown tinges, a one finger thick beige head which clings. Aroma is loads of malt, caramel, toast, honey, cereal, cherries, sultana, cherry brandy, vinous hints, caramel malt. Smells big. Taste- full and coating in the mouth, bitter hop background, lots of caramel and toffee malt, biscuit, cherry and raisin, quite a boozy finish, red wine, cherry liqueur. Long sticky finish, quite sweet by the end. Very good stuff.
Poured from a 22 oz bottle a deep, cloudy copper with a small tan head. Nose is caramel and ripe fruit. Medium sweet, slightly boozy.
Bottle from systembolaget orangy red in color thik like soup 1/2 finger head super god

Vackert bärnstensfärgad, grumlig med medelstort skum. I doften finns hur många olika torkade frukter som helst, knäck och en massa annat godis
Smak: Fyllig är bara förnamnet! Sanslösa fruktkombinationer och knäck och choklad tillsammans med en beska som får smaklökarna att stå i givakt. Går nästan inte att beskriva. Munkänslan är lite tjock och oljig, minst sagt fyllig.

On tap at Hourglass Brewery in Longwood , FL. 

A = clear, deep brownish-red, almost no head
S = caramel-molasses-alcohol
T = west coast barley wine-ish (think SN Bigfoot). Modest malt sweetness, caramel with robust hop bitterness. ETOH presence is apparent. 
M = close to heavy. 
O = really like this. A slow sipper for sure between the ABV and the bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at Craft and Draft, Amsterdam. Sweet malts, hops, alcohol. Long sweet malty aftertaste. Not bad.
Great beer. Aroma is malty, caramel, intense hops, and fruits. Taste is really sweet, mixed with the bitterness of the hops. Medium body, smooth texture, average carbonation. Long alcoholic finish.

Rica strong ale como un demonio. Maltosa, con frutas rojas, casi confitadas, licorosa y algo cítrica. En boca desde una entrada cítrica a todo el despliegue de las maltas para terminar en un final amargo y con presencia de alcohol

On tap at Craft & Draft Amsterdam. Dark ruby with a fine-grained off-white head. Caramel, maple syrup, dried fruit (figs, raisins) and a bit of cocoa. Soft mouthfeel, full bodied and with a sticky sweet aftertaste.

Draft 0.15l at Craft&Draft Amsterdam Netherlands. 03.05.2016.Taste with Zlotta.Pour it hazy red amber color with small white head.Aroma licorice,sweet,interesting.Taste starts with orange juice,smooth texture,sweet red fruits,alcohol kicking on the back.Average catbonation,can imGine this beer from the bottle.Really nice balanced.

39th Birthday and 200th US beer rating. Keg@brewdog, Birmingham. Dark amber beer with medium head and patchy lacing. Aroma red leaf, caramel and malts. Taste is caramel, red berries, dry hops and malts. Boozy. Very good.
Rubí oscuro y limpio con espuma marfil. Aromas de malas caramelo, anís, herbáceos y cítricos. Cuerpo denso y maltoso con iniciativa dulce acaramelado y un final de amargor resinoso intenso.
APPEARANCE: hazy amber with a large head. AROMA: caramel, malt, dried fruits and alcohol. TASTE: reflects the aroma. PALATE: full bodied, low to medium carbonation and medium to high bitterness.

Flaska från SB. Provning med ölsällskapet. Mörk mahognybrun med oljigt krämbeiget skum. Påminner om vanliga Arrogant Bastard i doften, men sötare. Det är rejält med kola, toffee, kakdeg jämte kåda och granskott. Även apelsin och mango anas. Superstor, oljig kropp med klibbig humlebeska. Lätt, lätt rökig i smaken, tillsammans med det som känns redan i doften. Stor beska som bärs upp och nästan hamnar i bakgrunden för den stora kroppen.

Jest klasycznie barlejowo, słody, słody, słody. Piwo treściwe, do bardzo powolnego sączenia. W aromacie wybija się konfitura różana (pierwsze piwo z taką nutą), suszone figi, słodki chleb wileński, irysy. Bardzo udany, nie zamulający barlejek.

Sweet full aroma, raisins, pours slightly hazy. Nice Amber color...very full taste, raisins, figs, leather, blood, sweat..
Extra ordinary..
Sample at BGM 2016. Dark brown, lots of sweetness, oily and smooth mouthfeel. Full bodied and complex.

[tap, Jabeerwockie, Warsaw]

Appearance small foam, small bubbles, creamy, long lasted. Dark amber, almost brown, a little bit cloudy. Nice.

Aroma: Nice! Rich palate of malts: grains, biscuits, caramel (raisins, muscavido, roasted sweet bread). Pleasent red fruits: apple and grapes. Some grassy/herbal notes. Alcohol is present, but it’s acceptable.

Taste: At the beginning very sweet, malty with hints of fruit. After second appears some strange, grassy, phenolic and taninn note. Herbal, spicy, acrid. It was really strange, but overall rather unpleasent - like beer fermented in too high temperature. Alcohol is present, nicely warms up throat.

Mouthfeel and bitterness: rather high bitterness. I feel phenols and alcohol present, making it long and sharp. Texture is oily, rich, thick, nicely pours in mouth. 

Overall

Aroma was great, I expected some world class beer, but in taste something strange appeared and it ruined the experience. Sincerely, if I paid half of the price, I would be satisfied, but for this money I expect more.

Tap@ BGM4Brown, hazy, small beige foam; lots of caramel, some roasty notes, lots of hops, high bitterness, medium+ sweetness, full body, oily feel, average- carbonation, long and intense bittersweet finish with lota of alcohol warmnessOverall: Great taste, very good aroma, balanced, noticable but quite well hidden and pleasant alcohol, very good beer

-- rated with beerbasher

Flaska som lagrats 3 år. Fasen vilken doft. Vänner av öl köp o lagra!!
Här finns hela registret. Torkad frukt o hav med tång. Härligt balanserad med fina toner av torkad frukt. Väl balanserad med en helt underbar efterbeska. Världsöl!!! Blir så imponerad av dessa bryggare från staterna.

Flarra som lagrats 3 år i ölkällaren i hovshaga. Doftar otroligt balanserat å fylligt av dadlar å fikon och tång. Satan jävlar vad fyllig och sjukt balanserad smak av dadlar , fikon, hav. Fin rejäl efterbeska . Oerhört god Tänk den dröm att svenska bryggare en dag ska kunna tillverka kvalité i denna klassen. Åh hoppas den dagen kommer
Pours dark brown with a foamy head. Aroma is malty and sea salt. Loads of caramel, toffee. Lovely

0.15 l on tap at ’Beertemple’. Clear, very dark red with a medium large, frothy, stable, tan head. Sweetish-fruity aroma of caramel, red fruits, some raisins and molasses. Sweetish-malty taste of caramel, raisins, prunes, molasses and red fruits, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter finish with some boozy hints. Full body, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very sweet, not that complex but very tasty.

Tap at BrewDog Manchester. Hazy red. Ring of head. Big aroma of piney, resinous hops and strawberry jam. Taste seems exactly like the regular version but bigger and more powerful. Retains good drinkability though. Good stuff.
Pours a darkish red/brown. Aromas of spice, coriander, yeast, and alcohol. Flavor has an alcohol taste to it, mixed with a nice smoky dark fruit. Also has a strong hint of spice.

Dark brown tan, cloudy, light tan head. Some alcohol on the nose, dark honey, light spice, coriander. Light bitterness, quite sweet. Upfront alcohol, medium body, oily. Low carbonation. Pretty great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.1 draft. A hazy, dark brown color with a nice, tanned head. Aroma of grapes, vanilla, wine, bourbon, dried fruits, and quite some caramel. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, resembles a barley wine to an extent. A full body, a smooth texture, and a below-average carbonation. Finish is long, wood and caramel are still prominent, and the barley wine comparison is still hard to get rid of. Overall the beer is quite simply pleasing, worth recommending.

Pompa w Jabeerwocky

WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemnobursztynowa, zamglone. Piana niska, drobna.   

AROMAT: Intensywny. Miks karmelu, owoców, cytrusów i ziół.

SMAK: Półwytrawne. Z początku bardzo gorzkie grejpfrutowe, po chwili do głosu dochodzi przypalony karmel i alkohol. Goryczka wysoka, garbnikowa, zalegająca. Ziołowo-karmowy posmak. Oleiste, ale nie gładkie. Jak na 11% alkohol jest bardzo dobrze wkomponowany w całość.

OGÓLNIE: Bardzo dawno nie piłem tak goryczkowego piwa z równie przyjemna karmelowo- ziołową kontrą.
22oz bottle. Powerful American strong ale. Beautiful color and smooth for 11%. Very nice
Tap na BGM. Piwo zdecydowanie robi robotę. Ciężkie, gęste, niemal oleiste. Masa charakteru słodowego, spora goryczka w posmaku. Świetna sprawa.

Clear, dark amber to red color with a one finger high, beige head. Nice lacing on the glass. 

 

Nose: Hops! Caramel malt, butterscotch, dried fruit, nutmeg, fudge, vanilla, plum and raisin. A bit of orange and citrus there to. 

Taste: A lot of malt, grape, orange zest, pine, grass, raisin and caramel. 

Mouthfeel: Full body. Oily and smooth. Medium carbonation. Dry and bitter ending.
Bottle from systembolaget. Dark amber with white head. Aroma is caramell, fruit. Taste is caramell, fruit, fruity sweetness and spices. Great in the beggining, did not grow on me.
Dark amber / reddish with almost no head. Strong sweet bread aroma. Sweet malty bread taste followed by very strong and spicy bitterness. Strong bitter aftertaste with spicy notes.

650ml 11% ABV bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Red–brown in colour with a thin white head of foam. This beer has a spicy red fruity, oak and malty flavour with currant and burnt toffee followed by bitter-sweet pine, dried fruit and gentle leather on the finish. Excellent!

Clear brown with creamy and lasting head. The aroma is a complex and unusual combination of juicy malts, spices and hops. Toffee and caramel, ginger bread, banana, cocacola like, burned multi cereal bread, raisins and lots of resin, orange peel , cinnamon, chocolate and some smoke.... Rich stuff. The mouth feel is oily and creamy. Quite strong carbonation for this style. Enough sweetness to make my lips sticky but has a huge hop and alcohol bitterness. Alcohol is a bit like cough syrup and not always enjoyable. But the beer is. Huge one.

On tap at the brewery (Richmond, VA). Aromas of caramel, toffee, resinous hops, some citrus. Hazy ruby with a fully lasting white head. Sweet like burnt sugar, bitter, subtle booze, pretty assertive. Medium-full bodied, sticky.

0,75 bottle at bottleshare night. - Aroma has an onslaught of caramel aromas. Very complex. Flavor has caramel, butterscotch, toffee and passionfruit. The flavor is slightly more malt-forward with tons of caramel, toffee and slight chocolate/coffee notes. The finish is not overly bitter, and its well balanced.
Bomber shared with dusty brian and jon...nose is really nice with caramel and toffee notes...the mouth follows with the same flavor and a good dose of hops....solid brew.

650cl bottle shared in a snifter. Deep red with a beige head which lasts quite well giving some pretty lacing. Aroma is as you would expect hops but not your normal kind. Very powerful but expertly blended to give a pleasantly clean taste with an astringent bitterness which demands respect. Over the top in every respect but the malt is nicely restrained as I had been wary of a syrupy backdrop to go with the extra ABV and hops but no this is better than the standard version (but not by much as that is already excellent).

Pours beautifully and looks like a calm, fiery sunset with an amazing head. Rich stewed fruits and caramel with hints of vanilla. The toast hits the nose but the taste is an evolving monster of flavour. The beer that keeps on giving....excellent!

Tap at Aluc Celle Riga. Hazy amber. Nuts, malts, wine, prunes, hopy hops.
Quite bitter, medium sweet. A lot of burnt sugar, caramel, prunes. Nice, good balanced, complex.

#2000 draught at Craft Hands. 2015 version. Rich dark caramel and figs, raisin and marmalade, big bourbon bite with lingering spices, syrupy body, dry warming finish . A big big brew, definitely a slow sipper, best enjoyed as digestif.
650ml bottle, 2014 edition. Hazy amber body with a very low brief head. Alcohol, caramel, orange zest, pine, toffee, citrus,

Poured from a 22 OZ bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is a clear brown color with a large white head. The aroma is full of hops with some toasted malt, very appealing. The taste is simply WOW!!! A world class beer.

Quite a treat. Big nose, intense maltiness, caramel, lots of dried fruits and berries, some wood touch, quite lovely hop kick, mostly citrus. Moderate sweet with moderate bitterness. Syrupy. Awesome sipper.
One delightful "muther of a beer" indeed. Toffee, caramel, citrus, rye, and bread taste. Spice in the aftertaste. Resiny and sticky. Creamy and smooth. Simply marvellous.

From a 650ml bottle on 12/2/2106 (ABV listed as 11%). Pours a cloudy dark reddy brown with a small head. The nose features caramel, toffee, rye, spice, honey, stone fruit and a bit of zesty citrus fruit. Flavour wise, this is huge - masses of caramel, butterscotch and toffee, brown sugar, sweet stone and stewed fruit, marmalade, bread, toast, rye and spice, followed by a hint of warming booze. It features a massive sticky, resiny bitterness which hits you like a punch in the face. The palate is syrupy and slick with modest carbonation. Extremely bold, rich and intense. Magnificent.

Bottle, 660ml. A clear reedish beer with a medium size brown head and minimal sediments. Aroma is of firewood, malt, alcohol and spices. Taste is bitter with a strong malt backbone. Some carbonation and astringency. Aftertaste reminds me of bourbon and it has an alcoholic finish. Well balanced and very smooth. Great beer.

Bottle, 660ml. Clear maple with a frothy brown head. Sweet caramel and toffee aromas with hints of fruity hops. Robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth and creamy, with rich roasted character and a complex bitter and alcohol finish. Exquisite.
A big, leathery, raisiny elephant that walks into the room and sits on your chest. Very good beer.

Dark red Amber pour with very little head. First taste and last tastes are all the same just fantastic. Very balanced malty but just hoppy enough. Really great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A big, sweet, boozy nightcap. Very well made, scoring high in almost all departments. If I have any complaint, it’s that the bottle size seems extravagant - a 330ml of this would be near perfect, rather than a pint and a bit. Perfect appearance: caramel brown with a thick head that lasts. Aroma was more restrained than I expected, perhaps due to the serving temperature. Brown sugar, brandied pears, raisins. Perfect palate: creamy smooth. Alcohol is well integrated - it’s the sugars that dominate til that big minty-piney finish. (Pint bottle from Leura Cellars. 2012 version)

On tap at Brewski, Brisbane. A mahogany brew with caramel malt, ethanol and piney hops on the nose. Complex taste profile with a nice balance between strong bitter and sweet components in the finish. This is one rich beer: a meal in a glass. Looking forward to trying the barrel aged versions.

22oz bottle pour at home with a bottle date of 10/13/15

Pours a deep copper color. 

Personally, the best thing about this beer is the mouthfell and the palate. 

Tastes like a mouthful of red and black licorice. 

Yet another great Stone beer

The beer pours a dark brownish amber color with a small head. The aroma has roasted malts, licorice and booze. Taste is big with a balance of caramel sugar, molasses and orange. The finish has some mild bitterness and mild alcohol. Good beer.

650ml bottle. 2015 edition. (11% ABV) Pours a hazy copper with a large, frothy, long lasting, beige head that laces nicely. Sweet, roasted aroma of caramel malt, overripe fruit, alcohol and piney hops. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, caramel, dried fruit, spices, booze, pine resin and grass with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Full body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Excellent, the name delivers as promised.

Appearance: clear deep amber with one fat finger of fluffy light tan head, medium retention and patchy lacing. (4/5) Aroma: pine, citrus, toffee, dried fruit, coffee & chocolate, alcohol, tobacco & leather, earthy. (9/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, strong bitter. (9/10) Palate: full slick and oily body, moderate carbonation, lingering boozy bitter finish. (5/5)

I waffled a little scoring this one. The flavours (particularly the hops) are somewhat overshadowed by the massive maltiness and ABV, so it’s not simply “Arrogant Bastard times two” - the balance and interplay of flavours are completely different. (That’s not to denigrate the value of a boozy big bastard, mind you.) However, the other factor here is that a lot of the complexity and depth of flavour - and there’s a lot - is overshadowed by the big malt and ABV, so to some extent it doesn’t completely succeed, even on its own terms. When I first reviewed this, I opined that it might benefit from a greater hop presence, but even in a relatively fresh example, the hops are massively overshadowed by the the malt and alcohol. Still, for all that, it’s lots of fun and actually a darn sight better than the Depth-Charged version I tried recently. (18/20)

Large frothy beige head deep brown pour strong medium carbonation aromas citrus pine toffee stone fruit chocolate butter scotch hint brandy woody note earthy the flavours caramel grapefruit medium strong bitter pine resin toffee apricot earthy note brandy buttery good body the finish best aftertastes resin crisp hops malt mix lasting alcohol bitter taste cracking ale

Pours amber with a large khaki head that moderately dissipates into a nice cap and good lacing. AROMA: malty, hop spice, peppercorn, bitter, phenols, grapefruit, caramel, roasty, spices, herbs, smoke, slight molasses and coriander. TASTE: malty, hop spice, peppercorn, bitter, phenols, grapefruit, leaves, grassy bitterness, boozy, caramel, spices, roasty, herbs, smoke, slight molasses and coriander. AFTER TASTE: malty, hop spice, peppercorn and bittersweet citrus with an oily spiced boozy finish.

Hazy deep copper pour. Off white head. Aroma of dried fruits, mild oxidation resulting in sherry notes. Full bodied, creamy. Sherry, dried fruits, wet wood, pine bitter finish. Alcohol is well integrated. Nice big one. 2013 edition.

Mahogany brown color, beige head. Caramel nose, wood, hint of coffee, sharp notes, grass. Sweet taste, caramel, dried fruit, wood, alcohol. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture. A bit too heavy and powerful.

From the bottle the pour is cloudy brown with an off white/brown shaded head, the aroma is toffee caramel and dried apricots or maybe pineapple some sort of fruit, the taste deep your caramel notes definitely some coffee on the front and there’s just a little bit of hops to brighten your taste buds and then it finishes roasted and malty Carmel.

Rating #1456 - 01.02.2015 - Bottle from @beerblast. Pours a copper amber, and exudes hoppiness right from the get go, powerful citrusy, grainy, fruity hops on the nose. Medium heavy carbonation, huge alcohol warmth. ABV not well disguised by hop character - foolishly absurd malty sweetness trainwrecked by aggressive bitterness, and punishing alcohol. Borderline stupid, and doesn’t hold a candle to its true champion little brother.

Rated from old notes. Very hoppy and in your face. Nothing subtle here. The bottle insults you and the beer follows through. Hops and lots of it with an almost acrid bitterness. Progressively boozy. Gave me a headache. I quit after 80% and went for an ice cream.

Pours deep mahogany brown with a very nice yellow-tan head. Aroma is potent caramel malts with some citrus hop. Taste is wham-bam thank you ma'am sticky molasses malt with some cotemp bitterness and a very happy aftertaste. Not too boozy despite its ABV. Bold but a bit sweet.

22 ounce bottle. Bottled on 10/13/15. 11% ABV. Pours a deep cooper color with a large creamy beige head. Rich caramel malt nose has notes of citrus and pine hops. Flavor is sweet caramel with notes of tropical fruits, roasted butternut squash and bourbon. Notes of dark fruit and nuts in midtaste. Woody and buttery finish. Complex and rich with boozy, sweet malt, spicy and resiny hops and subtle chocolate liquor notes.

deep copper amberwith a fairly frothy light brown head. nose is potent West Coast hopswith a touch of barley sweetness.this beer is aggressive as advertised with tons of hop bitterness balanced against a big sticky barley malt. alcohol is well hidden. A very well made American barleywine
Bottled. Pours nice dark copper. Has a nice dark Ale taste. The only thing I don’t like is the alcohol aftertaste other then that it is a great beer.
Pours dark amber and big lasting head. Smell is sweet and boozy. Isn’t as horid as I was expecting. Drinks mild but finishes big and boozy and too sweet.

Not entirely sure why they sell these in such big bottles. Slightly irresponsible I would suggest . Luckily I’m already on the sofa. Raisiny , pruney, very alcoholic. Slight chocolate. Intense. I can’t argue with this beer, one winner.

Intense! Holy mother. I wish I had the regular bastard to compare as it feels somehow even stronger. Simple palate but complex taste. Not for anyone but the most ready for extreme beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

20-NOV-2015, bottle (best before 2014) @Erik, from Systembolaget somewhere, thx.:-)
Murky, brown’ish, tan head.
All the American Strong Ale characteristics. Pine, grape fruit, caramel, almost roasted, fruity. Sweet, bitter. Clearly not fresh but still very tasty:-)

Bottle from Julio’s. A clear deep amber. Tan head that settles to a thin lace. Aroma of earthy sweet fruit. Alcohol is very well masked. Flavor is deep and complex. Well balanced bitterness and very smooth drinking. Notes of chocolate, prune, herbs, pine and coffee. Long lingering bitter finish.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares 1 Year Anniversary. Pours hazy reddish amber with a big offwhite head. Aroma is hoppy, sweet, caramel, malt, plums, vanilla, citrus. Taste is hoppy, fruity, bitter, malty, dark fruits.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares 1 year anniversary. Pours red amber with a beige head. Aroma has some rather big hoppy notes up front, behind that comes all the sweetness. Caramel, big fat sweet plums, deep malty profile and some weak vinous notes. The taste is hoppy with all of that big fat sweet fruity notes which leads to some vinous associations. Alcohol is quite present and the end is rather bitter from the hops. Yet this beer is a pleasure to sip but is indeed a mother drugger in terms of being intense.
One of my favorites! A bit pricey but occasionally worth it. Usually only a seasonal bear.

From the 2015 batch. Bottled 10/15/15. I actually thought I had reviewed this one before now. Reddish-brown pour under a full cream colored, foamy head. Interesting aroma of barley malts, grain, sweetness, but it really feels full all around. The body is medium to full. A bit more alcohol in the taste but everything else reflects the characters I picked up on the nose.

Strong and rich, I'm sure I'd be happier drinking out of a glass, rather than a cup. Rich and malty, the hops really fade into the background for me on this one. The alcohol is always lurking in the background.

Growler from Totalwine Tukwila to wine glass 		
appearance: dark reddish not a lot of head		
Aroma: very fragrant, boozy aroma		
Taste: delicious, medium bitterness, with sweet follow through		
full body with long finish 		
Excellent beer, one of the best, will definitely try again

I'm in heaven. I've had the Double Bastard but this one is 2 years old ('13). Excellent beer but I'm biased I love good aged beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with light brown creamy head. Aroma is really malts, caramel, bread, toast, coffee, raisins, plums strawberry but also with an hoppy edge. Taste is first toffee forward, coffee, caramel, toasty malts, raisins, light fruity berries and then turns really hoppy. Light dry alcohol in finish, sugary and sticky. Funny contracts, but it works. Really dry hoppy finish, really bitter.
Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares 1 year anniversary. Pours light hazy amber with a frothy head. Notes of danks hops, medium bitter, sweet malts with some caramel.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares 1 year anniversary! Pours a reddish, semi clear amber with a small, off white head. Aroma has lots of caramel malts, hops, fudgy sweet notes, banana, dark fruits, slight overripe apple. Taste is sweet and with lots of light caramel up front, but quickly gets very bitter. Lots of similarities with the arrogant bastard beer, just in a stronger version. Really nice.
Clear, amber colourl; great, beige head. Very strong, malty aroma, caramel, melanoidins, herbs, fruits. Taste is also malty with caramel, bread, pine, fruits and gentle bitterness.

Bottle bought at fluvian’s bottle shop in st. Andrews. Aromas abundant! Malts, carrot, tobacco, strong hops. Mouthfeel from here to eternity. Spruce, liqourice, citra, grapefruit, grass, prunes. Not really sweet but insanely full. Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic.

Fra flaske på Cardinal M2 sep-15: rødlig fargetoner med tett offwhite skum som varer. Vinøs aroma og smak i en velproposjonert kropp med overbevisende balanse. Røde bær, vanilje og mango for å nevne noe av smaksinntrykkene. Kompleks. Dæven, utbrøt Sigmund. Mild bitterhet og afterburn, men den varmer helt ned i lilletåa.
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 28.09.15. Reddish brown. Small beige head. Vinous aroma and taste, with malt, mature berries, plums and wood. Complex, interesting and good. Moderate bitterness.

Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours almost clear dark golden with a tiny white head. Aroma is heavy sweet and bitter, resiny and piney hops. Taste is llight sweet, like a barley wine with a decent dry hoppy finish, resiny and moreish.

Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy light brown with of-white head. Aroma of caramel, dark dried fruits, raisins, medicine. Tastes sweet; however, after a short while a distinct bitterness unfolds.

650 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 11%. Hazy reddish brown colour, moderate off-white head. Strong aroma of American hops, piney notes, also caramelized orange marmalade, some alcohol. Very hoppy flavour, medium sweet, caramel and alcohol. Bitter finish, hints of solvent.Warming mouthfeel. There’s plenty of hops in this one (surprise, surprise), but this is probably not where you go when you look for balance.

1pt 6 fl oz bottle from Brewdog online. Coppery amber colour, thin beige foam head and aroma of malt, orange marmalade, hop resins. Taste is sweet malty, caramel, toffee, raisins, booze, with grapefruit & pine and spicey bitterness. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry grassy boozy bitter finish. Aggressive, very drinkable

Cervesa amb aroma i sobretot gust a caramel, també és bastant licorosa però no pots separar-te d’ella.
Cerveza con aroma y sobretodo sabor a caramelo, también es bastante licorosa pero no puedes separarte de ella.

Big bottle in Amsterdam. Dark reddish body with slight head. Nose is caramel, malts, toffee, fruity. Taste is toasty ad malty and deep oaky. Really nice. Malts and sweets in there. Very alcy and comes in strong.
Poured from 1 pt 6 fl oz bottle - 2013 release [bottled 10/08/13] (11.2%). Medium amber brown with beige head. Lots of dried fruits, plum, and hops, very barley-winey, mild alcohol.

A Stone legendás főzetének arrogánsabb verziója hasonlóan tündöklő, réz színű köntösben jelenik meg, s atomerőmű intenzitású illatfergeteget szabadít ránk rögtön, az üveg felnyitását követően. Gyantából gyúrt tészta mázsás súlyú aromája terpeszkedik szét hirtelen, mézes tobozok, juharszirup gazdag aromája festi meg a levegőt. Vehemens illatai nem sok reményt hagynak a visszafogottabb fogyasztók számára ízét illetően, s ahogy sejteni lehetett, szinte szétrobban a szánkban az ízjegyek tűzijátéka. Nehéz zamatai alatt nyögnek az ízlelőbimbók, mézédes, túlcsordulóan telt testben szabadulnak el a szirupban fürdőző aszalványok, tejszínes gyümölcslikőr, komlótobozokkal díszített sárgabarackbefőtt vonalait megidéző komponensek. Hosszan elnyúló, mondanivalóval teli kesernye adja meg az ívét a főzetnek, melyet nem mindennapi jellege igazán emlékezetessé tesz szakavatott komlófetisiszták számára.

Pours dark amber with a small head.
Nose shows sweet malt, spicy and resinous hops, caramel and sultanas.
Flavours are equally spicy and herbal with heaps more malt following through afterwards alongside a bit of booze.

Keg at Ushers, at 10.5%. Pours clear deep ruby. Nose is sweet burnt toffee, malts, dried fruits. Very nice. Taste is sweet oaky caramel or burnt toffee, more oak and wood, decent bitterness, loads of maltiness. Very nice. Needless to say but this kind of beer out of keg without 30mins warming simply tastes horribly boozy.

Bottle, 2013. Pours amber, clear, solid head. Aroma is mainly malt and aome druits, quite clean. In taste medium sweet, a bit boozy and fruity with very strong bitterness, which is just fantastic, not harsh, not astringent etc. Medium body, dry finish. Very nice ale, maybe worth longer cellaring for the better aroma.

Bottle to tulip. Pours copper with an off-white head and a lot of sticky lacing. A lot of malt and dried fruit in the aroma, with some almonds hanging out in the background. Taste is a little sweet - raisins and caramel - with a lot of bitterness and boozy heat. Definitely no hiding the ABV in this one.

Dark amber, almost red hue with a cream coloured head. Prune, plum nose. Big caramel taste with burnt toffee & added woody, earthy bitterness.

Rated by BrewTom

2013 Bottle - July 4th BBQ tastings. 

Red appearance with thin white lacing. Aroma is oak, caramel, wood, some smoke cheese. Taste is oak, blackcurrants, smoked cheese, some Bamberg malts perhaps? If not I’d like to see some in this.

How: Bottle.

Where: Systembolaget.

Appearance: Dark amber colour with an off-white head.

Aroma: Dried fruit, caramel, raisin, sweet malt.

Body: Full body, low carbonation.

Flavour: Malt, hops, dried fruit, a bit vinous, caramel.
Draft. A hugely malt forward nose, I can smell the diabetes. Moderately to aggressive hop bitterness with a full bodied chewiness. Solid barley wine kind of beer.
Bottle. Pour is dark amber with a thin head, aroma is fruity, malty, sweet. Taste is fruity, alcohol. Great
Leicht trübes orange goldenes Bier mit einer geringen leicht beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig, reifes Obst, Karamell, Vanille. Geschmack alkoholisch, sehr malzig, Vanille, leicht holzig.

Bottle (2014): clear, deep copper red with a light head and good lace. Huge malty lift. Some fruit and huge caramel. Very intense. Very clean. Only really one dimension but a great example. Off dry to slightly sweet, not sour, high bitterness that’s balanced and it is hot. The palate is very fruit and intense. Great balance and flavor. Figs, raisin, fruit cake, caramel and dry spice. 
This is a massive beer but a great drink. I love the style.
Fantastic molasses and brown sugar sweetness that elevates it above the standard Arrogant Bastard.

Pours a dark chestnut with red hues, almost clear and with off-white head. Complex aroma with roasted almonds, herbs and big roasted maltiness. There’s a concentrated scent of whipped cream and with some wet wool in the background. Full bodied palate, big bitterness with a medicinal quality like Underberg herb liqueur. The finish is long with that medicinal bitterness on the back of the tongue.

It’s a beautiful pour, with dark amber color and thick beige head that stays with the brew. Nose is resinous and First sip is surprisingly low key in alcohol. This is a 2014 bottle. Sweet, malty start with a bright hop finish. It’s not as clean on the palate, which I enjoy. After a few sips, it is almost the same affect as chewing on a hop flower. Those flavors linger! Great strong beer. For the alcohol, it is easy to drink. Plan so age a second bottle to test against next couple years.

650ml bottle enjoyed @ my vacation apartment. Pours cloudy dark ruby with a lasting beige head. Aroma is malt, herbs, raisins, alcohol, caramel and fruits. Flavour is bitter. Full bodied, thick texture, average carbonation. Finish is resinous and bready malt.

How have I never rated this? Bomber. Deep amber with a beige head. Huge hops and malts in the aroma. Big complex fruit pretty much runs the gamut. The flavor is exactly the same. Complex and big fruit. Huge malts, too. Some spices and caramel. Brown sugar, harshness, alcohol, and big bitterness. My taste buds are being assaulted!
Pours a dark brown with a thick beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, fruity with some hops and spices. Taste is high sweet leading to dry bitter finish. Excellent!

Pours a cloudy orange-brown with an off-white head and nice lace. Sweet aroma, nice citrus, bitterness in the finish. Thick, sweet malt and nice bitter aftertaste. Thick body and good carbonation. Tasty!

660ml bottle from Drygate. Reddish brown, reasonable head. Grain alcohol malt aroma. Sweet woody alcohol malt flavour. Woody alcohol aftertaste. Love the attitude of this beer. I don’t normally like beer thsi strong but this one is good.

Bottle purchased at Elevated. Consumed with Saturday Shirt. Pint glass. Deep amber color with an off white head. Aroma has the traditional Stone hop elements but a little bit more malt sweetness than most. Taste has plenty of hops but it’s undercut by sweetness. It’s very drinkable and highly enjoyable. The alcohol is well hidden. Little bit of bitterness at the end. This is a great beer by one of the best hop centric breweries. Definitely worth a try. You bastard.
650ml bottle. Deep ruby ​​red. The aroma of a whole bag of sweet caramel. The taste is firmly bitter, simultaneously sweet, hard candies, raisins, plums, sawdust. Several complex and deep flavors.

This mighty brew is really a treat. Aroma is dark fruits, sweet notes of vanilla, plums and caramel. The taste is also on the sweeter side of the spectrum, but with the massive hop profile it manages to keep up a certain attitude as a trouble maker. A true bastard.
A very big beer. Mouthfeel is almost perfect. Great hops and huge punch with the 11%. You can definitely taste the booze. Overall this is a great beer.

Bomber to a pint... Hazy copper-amber with thin tan head and lacing. Toffee with floral and pine resin nose. Layered and complex flavors, smooth, balanced, dry bitter finish. Hides the ABV well... Excellent Strong Ale!

Pours a dark red with a 1 finger off white head. Has the aroma of dark fruit and caramel, Strong flavor that follows nose with lots of malts and a booziness and heat at the end but that is not a complaint, its part of the experience. Next time I go to Illinois I will be picking up a few more bottles.

This beer is amazing. Deep, rich, complex maltiness. High gravity and residual dissolved sugar content. You might wish to have a glass of ice water to chase each sip. One bomber might put you in a diabetic and alcoholic stupor. This is a big boy beer or one to share if you bought the bomber. I have all but forgotten the regular bastard by Stone brewing after drinking this beer!

From the bomber, it appears almost black with red highlights, has a nice white collar. At first tastes like sweet malt, then hops and bitter, with an exhale of alcohol. All things considered i would think this is the type of beverage "The Devil" would serve you if you were invited to his home to discuss terms of an agreement. The warmth and rapid buzz might loosen one up to sign the paper.
Amazing beer! First taste is a caramel with a hop finish! Color is a brown reddish. Smell is floral. If you want a beer with lots of character this is it!
Poured bright reddish amber with a tan head. Aroma of dense, concentrated berries, floral hops and caramel malt. Full body, flavour is sweet berries, toffee, moderately bitter hops.

When the aroma which makes pear and melon remember is accepted, the sweetness of the malt stands out at the beginning, but mellow sweetness and moist bitterness follow about a tongue after that. Indeed, for rate beer, the beer for which a high score is taken. It's wonderful!

Aroma: bread, alcohol, raisin, 
Appearance: orange-red, clear, slight tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long bitter finish, 

Delicious

Freshness makes all the difference here and this is a huge improve from my last bottlem. Signature Stone rawness with much delectable twisted rubber hop bitterness throughout the length. Deep glowing hazy reddish brown. Limited head. A glorious blow to the head.

Bomber, 2013 release. Clear deeper red copper, fine firmer lasting tan foam. Alcohol infused version of the prefered original, more like an intense barley wine. Average carbonation, full bodied, aggressively hopped. DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys)

Pours a hazy copper creamy white head, aroma is toasted bread and some caramel, low hop aroma. Taste has lots of rich breast malty some pumpernickel and some caramel, medium to low bitterness, alcohol is well hidden. Reminds me a lot of a doppelbock. Medium body medium carbonation.

My second venture into my Bastard Box. Pours dark copper with a thin off white head. Big sweet caramel malt aroma with pineapple and grapefruit. Starts with citrus hop forward flavor followed by big caramel malt and toffee that balances out the hops. Then the bastard comes out and you are hit in the tongue with huge hops. Big orange and bitter grapefruit finish. Leaves your tongue tingling.
One of my favorites. Lives up to the billing ten fold, wish I could find more of the bba aged version...

Massive malt and hop bomb. So much for the palate after this, huge citrus hop aroma and flavor. Big malty aroma as well. Big malty taste, well balanced hugeness. Some alcohol, enjoyable. Only need one 22 oz bomber

PRELUDE = I am not a hophead... I prefer this over the Arrogant Bastard. Still has a ton of aggressive hops that are up front and in your face. The balance however made this beer beer drinkable while staying true to being a Bastard. Maybe it was the higher abv, I don’t know. Again while not really what i prefer to drink, it was a good experience. Can really see why people who like this type of beer would love this.
Kopparfärgad klar med ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar mycket karamellmalt, lite humle och ganska mycket beska på slutet med lite alkoholsmak. Som en riktig bra barleywine
one of the best ive had. very sick appearance... looks like pure camel. yum!

Karamellfärgad. Doft av karamell & torkad frukt såsom aprikos. Fantastisk sötig karamellhet, torkad frukt, balanserad, fyllig med en fantastisk bitter slät avslutning. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Glory be to the bastard king. While not a beer in the regular sense of the word, this is pure liquid gold. Fruity without being sweet, heavily bitter without the soap and perfume, pleasantly chest warming without the residual taste of alcohol. If it just looked a wee bit better in the glass this would be close to the perfect beverage.

Quite cloudy dark red-brown, beige sudsy head. Smells of black treacle, brown/candied sugar, roasted malt, pine needles, musty grassy almost herbal hop bitterness. Tastes of toffee, nuts, resinous hop, pine, finishes with light spice, malt, maple syrup. Body is very smooth, creamy and lightly spicy. Flavours are big and complex but somehow the beer isn't overwhelming or too sweet. Good beer - doesn't taste like much else - though I think I like the original Bastard ever so slightly more.

Bottle from QClub at home. Deep deep copper brown pour - hazy to the point of opacity. Thin foamy head. Aroma is similar to the others in the bastard series - very dank and hoppy with a pronounced bready maltiness. Taste is similar.
